messages: 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (14:40): 2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad: my Japanese handset should have a NetFront based browser, but I've never used it.
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:41): in my case, both my phone and my 3DS use NetFront based browsers
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:41): however, the latter is the NetFront WebKit-based browser
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:41): I just wonder if anyone knows any particular tips for it
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:50): especially since it has incomplete canvas support
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:50): it works, but some features are missing
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:51): and it has very little memory
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (14:52): My handset is like 5yr old so I don't expect that it supports canvas.
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:52): it's from last year, maybe year before
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (14:57): I believe WebKit used in 3DS browser is kinda dated.
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (14:58): they package it up and make it easier to port
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (15:01): ooh. the Changelog shows the last commit is dated as of 2009-12-21
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:01): So it has the capabilities of... 2 year old webkit

2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:02): Notably, the browser engine of the 3DS is listed as "NetFront(R) Browser NX 1.0", so presumably there is or will be a newer version at some point in the future
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (15:02): Version.xcconfig says that webkit version is 532.8
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (15:03): can't remember what kinda features that Cr4 offered...
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:04): HTML5 video and audio was added before version 4
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:05): 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e: thanks for the open source link btw
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (15:05): Ha! at that time there weren't stable builds for Mac and Linux
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:06): they're probably disabled, but there is a folder for them
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:06): it might just be stubs, though
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:09): oh, says they don't when I go to a test
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:09): they were either incomplete or disabled at build-time
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:14): 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e: although it's practically guaranteed to be disabled
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:14): Thing is, unfortunately, it uses WebKit
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:15): except people looking for old deprecated elements
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:20): 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e: woo, 3DS canvas seems to be properly done
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:20): where it ignored one of my transforms
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:20): and hence everything was double the correct height
99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (15:24): 2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad: woops. mislooked '3DS canavas' as 3D canvas. bah.
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:24): you know what really excites me? CSS 3d transforms
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:24): you know what I hate about them?
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:25): seriously, they would otherwise be a really nice way to do 3D in the browser
eb3f49ff0e7508a6bd7e68a4f9ef04d4 (15:41): paul_irish my issue was closed? http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=104075
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:55): if I can render JPGs in the browser
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:55): I can display 3D images using data URLs
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:56): because the 3DS supports displaying 3D images in the browser
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:56): and MPO is just two JPEGs concatenated
2f9d518848f2539fc7f17c1e518648ad (15:57): now to somehow make a JPEG with JS
